docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Joletha Simmons, a 34-year-old addict, mixes heroin with water on a soda can, heats the mixture with a flame and draws it into her syringe. Then, peering into a mirror, she puffs her cheek to make a vein stand out in her neck and plunges the needle in. She pauses to wipe tears from her eyes, then bows her head, as if in prayer, while the drug takes effect.
